channel.title: Image Processing on AesVoy
channel.description: Recent content in Image Processing on AesVoy

item.title: Quiet Eye Phenomenon
item.description: Quiet Eye (QE) is a fascinating phenomenon that involves a period of extended visual attention, which significantly enhances the control and execution of motor skills, especially in high-pressure situations. This technique has been shown to improve performance across various domains, including sports and surgical training, by allowing individuals to focus on critical details just before executing a movement.

item.title: Weighted Voronoi Stippling
item.description: Stippling, a timeless artistic technique, traces its origins back through the annals of art history, where it emerged as a method of creating texture, depth, and form through the precise placement of dots.

item.title: Difference of Gaussians(DoG) Algorithm
item.description: The Difference of Gaussians (DoG) algorithm is a technique in image processing used for edge detection and feature enhancement.

item.title: Kuwahara
item.description: Kuwahara was the world’s first edge preserving de-noising image processing algorithm.

item.title: Dither
item.description: In the realm of digital image processing, dithering algorithms play a crucial role in reducing the color palette of an image while maintaining visual quality.
